text: François-Marie-Casimir Négrier François-Marie-Casimir Négrier (27 April 1788 in Le Mans – 25 June 1848 in Lille) was a French general who fought in the Napoleonic Wars and the 1848 Revolution. Aged 12 he accompanied Jean Lannes on his embassy to Portugal. From 1830 he was colonel of the 54th Infantry Regiment. ==References== ==Sources== * Category:1788 births Category:1848 deaths Category:People from Le Mans Category:French generals Category:French military personnel of the Napoleonic Wars Category:Grand Officiers of the Légion d'honneur
title: François-Marie-Casimir Négrier
